answerText: "Araby"[10] The death of Father Flynn, who had suffered a mental breakdown following the accidental breaking of a chalice, is the subject of this Dubliners story.
heading: ACF Winter |2009 | The Last Stand of Eponym Eponymovich | 17 | Literature | American | College
subject: Literature
question: Question: Identify the following James Joyce stories, FTPE: [10] The protagonist, a young boy, goes to the title bazaar to purchase a gift for the sister of one of the boys he plays with, but he gets there just as the bazaar is closing and ends up not buying anything.
